author: Inside Edition
description: The Bachelor's Clayton Echard had a brief romantic encounter with Laura Owens, who he says later tried to destroy him. Echard says Owens sent him an email claiming she was pregnant with his baby before filing a paternity suit. Echard denies her allegations saying they never had intercourse. He says Owens bombarded him with ultrasounds, which he says are fake. Owens later said she had suffered a miscarriage and wanted the paternity suit dropped, but then came a jaw-dropping turn.
title: TV Star Clayton Echard Speaks Out Saying He Was Targeted In Scam

author: Inside Edition
description: Trick or Treating has been going on for generations, but there are some Halloween do's and don'ts you may not be aware of. Inside enlisted the help of Thomas Farley, better known as Mr. Manners. He said to only take one candy unless you're instructed otherwise, so don't grab a whole fistful. When a home does not have the candy you like, "You simply say 'thank you.' You don't say, 'I don't like that candy,'” Farley says. He also recommends ending trick-or-treating around 9 p.m.
title: Dos And Don'ts For Halloween Trick-Or-Treating

author: Inside Edition
description: Holly Hill was on a Valentine's Day date with her husband, Brandon, when tragedy struck. She ordered a margarita at a Mexican restaurant near her home in Oklahoma. After one sip, she ran to the bathroom and called her mom saying she needed to go to the emergency room. Somehow, Hill's margarita had been mixed with an industrial oven cleaner. The restaurant says, "Everyone was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of Holly Hill … the individuals involved in that incident were terminated."
title: Margarita Mixed With Oven Cleaner Led To Woman's Death, Family Says

author: Inside Edition
description: Many people are accustomed to getting new mattresses by helpers carrying it into their homes and putting it on the bedframe. Now, after being compressed at the factory, a delivery person drops off your new mattress in a box and you do the work. Jaden King and her boyfriend Michael Bevers were excited to get their new mattress, and they were in for quite a surprise when the mattress suddenly popped out. Inside Edition learned there is a correct way of unwrapping your new mattress.
title: How To Correctly Open A Vacuum-Sealed Mattress

author: Inside Edition
description: Country star Luke Bryan opened up for the first time about the tragic death of his sister Kelly. The family has never revealed her cause of death until now. Bryan spoke to Anderson Cooper on his CNN podcast "All There Is," where Copper talked to celebrities about losing loved ones. Bryan said Kelly died of Sudden Death Syndrome. Kelly died in 2007 but it's only now that the singer, who is a judge on "American Idol," says he is able to talk about her death.
title: Country Star Luke Bryan Opens Up About His Sister's Death

author: Inside Edition
description: The teacher shot by a 6-year-old student took the stand Thursday. Abby Zwerner told the jury that she thought she was on her way to heaven when she was shot. Zwerner said two days before she was shot she had a nasty encounter with the student. Zwerner, 28, is suing the former assistant principal of her school. Attorneys for the assistant principal say no one could have foreseen that a 6-year-old would bring a firearm to school.
title: Teacher Shot By 6-Year-Old Student Takes Stand

author: Inside Edition
description: Officials say 87 senior citizens had to be evacuated from a retirement home in Michigan, so the local police had their work cut out for them. The Southgate Police Department says the assisted living center caught fire around 10 p.m. Officials say 39 officers from 11 law enforcement agencies, as well as dozens of firefighters, responded to the scene. Residents had to be carefully guided out of the building, many of them needing assistance. Inside Edition Digital’s Mara Montalbano has more.
title: 87 Seniors Evacuated From Assisted Living Facility Fire In Michigan

author: Inside Edition
description: The nineteen-year-old told a deputy that his mother was rushing him to take his younger brother home. Cops say the teen was driving across a bridge more than 60 miles over the speed limit with his kid brother in a passenger seat.
title: Teen Tries To Blame Mom For Driving Over 100 MPH #shorts

author: Inside Edition
description: Two bandits dressed as construction workers broke into the home of a wealthy New York City jeweler and stole $3.2 million in jewelry and gold in their backpacks.
title: Thieves Posing As Construction Workers Swipe Millions From NYC Jeweler #shorts

author: Inside Edition
description: Moments before a Kentucky sheriff fatally shot a judge inside his judicial chambers, the sheriff, Shawn Stines, used the judge’s phone to call his teenage daughter. Police say the number for Stines’ daughter was saved in Judge Kevin Mullins phone, and there were rumors that the judge was in a relationship with her.
title: Daughter of Sheriff Who Killed Judge Addresses Rumors #shorts

author: Inside Edition
description: A $200,000 custom Range Rover has gone missing. Who would pay that much to customize an SUV, you ask? None other than Shaquille O'Neal. The vehicle was en route to Louisiana when it was reportedly stolen in transit somewhere near Atlanta. The company that customized the car for Shaq says they're eager to get it to their client ASAP. Inside Edition Digital’s Mara Montalbano has more.
title: Shaq's $200K Custom SUV Reportedly Stolen In Transit

author: Inside Edition
description: Police bodycam footage from the day a teacher got shot by her first-grade student played in court Wednesday. Twenty-eight-year-old teacher Abby Zwerner is suing her school's former assistant principal, alleging that Ebony Parker failed to act after four people told her about concerns that the student had brought a gun to school.
title: Police Bodycam Plays In Court From Day 1st Grader Shot Teacher #shorts
